title: Puerto Rico hotel GM recognized for excellence
text:
Puerto Rico hotel GM recognized for excellence   02, 2015 Jacqueline Volkart   
SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico - Jacqueline Volkart, General Manager of The Ritz-Carlton San Juan, has been recognized by Worldwide Branding for showing dedication, leadership, and excellence in hotel management. 
Ms. Volkart is a luxury hospitality veteran with nearly three decades of experience, twenty of them with The Ritz-Carlton at various properties. 
As general manager of The Ritz-Carlton San Juan, Ms. Volkart led the hotel to achieve Sustainable Tourism Facility status as part of the Ecotourism and Sustainable Tourism Program developed by the Puerto Rico Tourism Company (PRTC). This is the second time a hotel that she has managed has been recognized for focusing on sustainable principles, natural and cultural conservation, environmental education, community integration and local social-economic development. 
A people person, Ms. Volkart achieved her success through her passion for the hotel business. She believes that success is only possible when inspiring others, and that any project can be achieved with a team of passionate individuals. Her continued aim is to share, teach and connect to others, and to be a role model to hospitality professionals around the globe.
